pros: Lots of great learning opportunities!
cons: The pay is not very much

pros: Pleasant students great co-workers. Good work life balance
cons: Administration with minimal experience in leadership. Poor pay

review_title: A stable place to grow your knowledge and abilities
pros: 1) A very small environment 2) Colleagues are accessible 3) Limited Guidance 4) Everyone wants to help students be successful
cons: 1) Little to no room for promotion 2) Raises are the exception and not the norm 3) Some area heads are stuck in the past 4) Some offices are built upon a toxic environment 5) Some people are never held responsible for their mistakes

pros: Great team environment across campus. Everyone is willing to help when needed.
cons: Low pay for the amount of work given.

pros: Lots of flexibility for student workers
cons: Does not have the highest pay but better than some other student leadership programs

review_title: Great place to build experiences in Higher Ed
pros: The facilities are excellent and always being invested in.
cons: The University hasn't been able to increase its undergrad enrollment in earnest over the last few years

pros: small friendly passionate academic community
cons: small town provincial community attitudes

pros: Overall People, Campus setting, Vision, and the Culture
cons: I truly can't think of any!

pros: great way to learn about cultures and meet new people
cons: I was very overwhelmed with the work load

pros:
Project Management
Supply Chain
Project Controlling and Planning
cons: Finance, Marketing, Budgeting, Reengineering, Human Resource, Planning

job_title: Graduate Assistant Coach in Rockford, IL
pros: Rewarding work and great atmosphere
cons: Need to love what you're doing

job_title: Head Cross Country Coach in Rockford, IL
pros:
It's a great entry point to get into higher education
My supervisor is very supportive
Staff and faculty care a lot
cons:
The University is tight with money, so more ambitious projects take a lot of time to get done.
Slight disconnect with leadership about what they think RU is and what RU really is.

pros: Rockford Soccer has a great boss and fun place to work at
cons: There are not any Cons

pros: It is a collaborative and supportive environment.
cons: Change is slow if anemic.

review_title: Rockford College will be a fun place to work, in 5 years, it is still on the way back up
pros: The flexible hours and quality of life that working on a College campus provides is evident at Rockford College.  In lieu of providing additional compensation efforts are made in other ways to show appreciation and worth to the organization.
cons: The level of politics on a college campus is immense.  Decisions that should be made simply by discussing them openly can be hampered with the desire not to offend anyone.  Management is disabled by a few key individuals that poison the atmosphere for progress.

review_title: Slow to innovate and let employees try out and experiment with new ideas
pros:
many great employees
collegiate atmosphere
many supervisors are caring and try to help employees in need
tuition reimbursement and other benefits
cons:
the college is slow to innovate
most departments allow little to no room for employees to try out new ideas
little decision-making autonomy
pay is pretty low compared to similar institutions, little opportunity for pay raises and promotions

job_title: Director of Student Activities in Rockford, IL
pros: Fun and engaging environment, supportive staff, student interaction. Great job to get you in the door. Staff always tried to be supportive with minimal resources. Great job for somebody, and great culture for somebody just wasn't great for me!
cons: Work life balance, lack of direction, lack of response to student concerns. Hesitant to try new things and traditions, and tough job if you have a growing family.

pros: interesting colleagues from diverse backgrounds and supportive work environment
cons: Since the University Safety & Security Department runs 24/7/365, there are not as many opportunities to enjoy some of the more common benefits of working for a university, such as a summer schedule or holidays off

pros: I love working as a graduate assistant at Rockford University. Lots of opportunities for learning and networking with professors.
cons: Politics of this university can be frustrating. There are some people with very strong egos. Overall, a good organization to work for.

review_title: Great students, staff and faculty, yet the institution is struggling to find its footing.
pros:
Academic freedom 
Good students overall
Beautiful campus
cons:
Heavy teaching load
Some students are not ready for college
Upkeep of buildings is lacking

review_title: Great place to work and awesome faculty.
pros: Wonderful faculty, no micromanaging, excellent benefits, very little stress, and flexible hours
cons: The pay is very poor, but the school is private and not funded by the state.

pros: Tuition assistance, even for part time employees, was a helpful benefit.
cons: Paid time off (sick time, vacation) would have been a nice benefit for part-time employees, even in a small amount.

pros: My kids got free schooling because i worked there.
cons: Most of the buildings were built in the early 60 and need maintenance all the time and Aramark does not have a clue what they are doing
